intro: Dieffenbachia plumieri, commonly known as the "Snow Plant," is a tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves that often feature white and green patterns. The plant belongs to the Araceae family, which includes many ornamental plants known for their unique foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Dieffenbachia plumieri is popular as a houseplant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
